DOC.HEAD: Southland Closes Citgo Sale
DOC.TEXT: The Southland Corp. announced Thursday it signed a definitive agreement to sell its half interest in Citgo Petroleum Corp. for $661.5 million in cash to the Venezuelan state-owned oil company. The deal, first announced on Nov. 6, had originally been for $675 million but was reduced in further negotiations between Southland, which owns the 7-Eleven convenience store chain, and Petroleos de Venezuela SA. The sale will be closed Jan. 31, Southland said.
